description: The course introduces students to the religious traditions of India through lectures, readings,
discussions, and excursions, including interaction with leaders of religious communities. Indian
religious scholars and practitioners provide background for understanding the history, beliefs,
and practices of major religious traditions of India, including Hinduism, Islam, and Christianity,
and Indian perspectives on religious pluralism and interfaith relations. Offered periodically
